alert.note: Alert for Greater Portland Metro Area (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 22 at 12:59PM PST until February 23 at 1:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM PST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 5 above zero. * WHERE...Greater Portland Metro Area. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 1 AM PST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from midnight tonight to noon PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will likely impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures will gradually fall this afternoon and lead to any water and slush on surfaces freezing quickly this evening. Locally higher snowfall amounts are possible through this evening, particularly for areas near the mouth of the Columbia River Gorge and elevations closer to 500 feet and above. Gusty east winds will result in areas of blowing snow near the entrance to the Gorge this afternoon and evening.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
